content: Validate GPU/CUDA environment: torch.cuda.is_available(), RTX 2080 Ti detection, CUDA 12.4 compatibility
Test TiRex model loading: tirex.load_model(device='cuda'), memory allocation, inference timing baseline
Verify nautilus_binance_native client: create_nt_native_integration(), API connectivity, rate limits
Test 1-hour data collection on 2-day range: validate BinanceBar format, warm-up calculation, file output
Test 1-minute data collection on 2-day range: memory usage monitoring, processing efficiency, data volume
Validate temporal alignment: overlap detection, synchronization accuracy, boundary alignment
Complete 1-minute TiRex processor: handle 60x volume, memory efficiency, inference timing
Implement adverse excursion analyzer: intrabar simulation vs real excursions, MAE/MFE calculation
Create statistical comparator: chi-square tests, t-tests, Bonferroni correction, confidence intervals
Build comprehensive output system: JSON structure, CSV exports, error handling, file management
Integration testing: end-to-end pipeline test on small dataset, error propagation, logging validation
Run pilot study: 1-week data range, validate all metrics, check computational performance
Analyze pilot results: stop-out rate comparison, adverse excursion patterns, statistical significance
Scale to full study: 1-3 month range, monitor resource usage, handle any performance issues
Deep analysis of adverse excursions: MAE distributions, stop-loss trigger patterns, success destruction rates
Statistical significance validation: p-values for all metrics, effect size calculation, confidence bounds
Computational cost-benefit analysis: processing time ratios, memory usage, infrastructure requirements
TiRex prediction quality assessment: accuracy at 1m vs 1h, noise-to-signal ratio, reliability metrics
Trading simulation comparison: realistic execution modeling, transaction costs, slippage effects
Evidence synthesis: compile all metrics, identify clear winners/losers, assess trade-offs
Generate timeframe recommendation: decision matrix, risk-adjusted performance, implementation feasibility
Document key findings: update MTUP analysis, record methodology, highlight critical insights
Create result visualizations: adverse excursion heatmaps, stop-out comparisons, performance charts
Validate conclusions: peer review methodology, check for biases, verify statistical rigor
Plan follow-up research: identify next questions, suggest improvements, recommend iterations
